message.raw:
Fix for issue #40, globals diffing

- Fix incompatibility with pandas 0.20, in which df.sort() is deprecated.
df.sort_index() is used instead. This method has existed since at least 0.15,
so switching to it is backward compatible.

- Fix regression introduced in c4f793b8 which failed to print diff table
to output box due to a simple typo.
message.html:
Fix for issue #40, globals diffing

  • Fix incompatibility with pandas 0.20, in which df.sort() is deprecated.
    df.sort_index() is used instead. This method has existed since at least 0.15,
    so switching to it is backward compatible.

  • Fix regression introduced in c4f793b8 which failed to print diff table
    to output box due to a simple typo.

message.raw:
Moved all the globals diff utility functions and implementation from __main__.py
into __init__.py (not optimal, but it's where dict_diff & other utilities are).
Turned these into general purpose functions globals_diff_groups (which accepts
two sets of globals groups) and globals_diff_shots (which accepts filenames).

These can be used outside of the runmanager GUI, for example globals_diff.py,
which can be added to the (right-click) 'Send to' menu on Windows by copying a
shortcut to globals_diff.bat in shell:sendto.

message.raw:
Fixes bug with the implementation of #36.

Expansion of globals (to calculated number of shots to compile) is now deferred until after the expansion groups have been updated.
This fixes an exception that was raised when changing a global part of an automatic zip group (one created because a second global referenced the first) from a list to a single value.

Performance optimisations for globals setting and parsing.

Should be much more responsive when changing globals when many globals
and groups are in use.

Note: Large h5 files due to many changes over time without repacking
still affects performance, this is yet to be addressed.

message.raw:
Fixed bug where diffing globals files didn't work.

This was because the runmanager API had an line in it that was an attempt
at forward compatibility for Python 3, aliasing 'str' to the name 'unicode'.

However, it did this in python 2, when it should have done it in python 3.

This is now fixed. Attempts at forward campatability are untested and only
there to make future porting easier, nothing is actually intended to work
on Python 3 at the moment.

message.raw:
Resolves Issue #24: Globals with fixed length string are not sorted correctly in Qt.

For raw (unevaluated) globals values, units and expansions, fixed lenth
strings (np.str_) are converted to Python unicode strings on read.

For evaluated globals, fixed length strings are converted to python str().

message.raw:
Resolves bitbucket issue #3. The top three tabs are now not movable.

This was a little tricky to do because Qt does not allow for setting individual
tabs movable or not. Furthermore, the relevant methods one has to override on
the QTabBar contain a lot of calls to private methods, which makes re-implementing
their behaviour more work than is worth it.

So instead, I did a bit of a hack - the subclassed TabBar keeps track of whether
its individual tabs are supposed to be movable or not, and it turns the global
setting on and off on mouseclick and mouserelease events, ensuring that when
you click an unmovable tab, you will find that it is unmovable and when you click
a movable tab, that it is movable.

It seems to work.

message.raw:
Fixed bitbucket issue #11. The shot output folder is now configurable in
labconfig. If not present, it defaults to %Y/%m/%d (with slashes according to OS)

It is as parsed by time.strftime()

Extra percent signs are needed as escape character in labconfig due to percent
symbols having special meaning in the config files:

[runmanager]
output_folder_format = %%Y-%%b/%%d

message.raw:
Resolves bitbucket issues #4, #5, #6, #7, #9, and #10.

#4 arrow keys now move selection up, down, left or right in globals tab and
   groups tab.

#5 Hitting enter when a cell is selected now enters edit mode on it.
   Furthermore, hitting enter or spacebar on a non-editable cell triggers
   its left-click action, whatever that may be.

#6 Tab now takes you to the next column after editing a global (shift-tab
   takes you back). This can no longer be used to edit cells that are supposed
   to be uneditable.

#7 After changing a value, if the units cell is empty is is highlighted for editing.

#9 Delete button moved back to the left for globals. Not as easy to move the
   delete button back to the left for groups, as treeviews where items have
   children only support the first item having children, and it would be silly
   to have the expansion button out next to empty space, since file rows in the
   groups tab don't have delete buttons.

#10 Creating a new group now automatically marks it as active and opens it.

message.raw:
Wrote get_shot_globals function, which reads evaluated globals from a shot h5 file.

This method applies hacks to modify datatypes as they are read. In particular,
it converts null h5py.Reference objects to None.

At shot file creation time, the reverse conversion occurs, converting None
to null h5py.Reference objects. In this way we can store None as a global.

Also fixed a bug where error message formatting crashed due to a typo

message.raw:
Implemented martijn's improvements to glabals diffing from the other branch.

Slight improvement: whitespace differences are also ignored along with comments.
Also comments are stripped more robustltly than with .split('#').
Both of these are achieved with the stdlit tokenize module (which is
exactly for this sort of purpose).

As in the other branch's implementation, differences are only reported
if both the value and the expression that produced it (ignoring comments
and whitespace) differ. This is important because some types of objects
always give False on equality checks, so that produces false positives.

Fixed bug in dict_diff that improves its comparison of nnarrays.

Made ctrl-c kill the program

Made groups open on double click (and go to the appropriate tab)
